702645f-a.title: Brooklyn: 21st Street (East) - Caton Avenue
702645f-a.text:
112 East 21st Street, adjoining the S. W. corner of Caton Ave.,
showing the Clarkson Mansion, built in 1836. Early in its history
the house was purchased by a group of prominent Flatbush men who
formed the Midwood Club nnd so named the mansion. Later the Nid-
wood Club was purchased b leaders of tho Broollyn Union League
Club who made it their headquarters for a time. From 1927 to 1940
the house was the headqmarters of tha Flatbush branch of the Y. M. C. A.
and was known as the Sperry Memorial Biuilding. On Jonuary 21, 1940,
A fire wrecked the structure and toward the end of the year, or
early 1941, was torn down to mske way for an apartm:ent house. For
additional data see 'The New York Times,'' Octoher 6, 1940.
1927
Views 1,2,3
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection

702644f-b.title: Brooklyn: 21st Street (East) - Caton Avenue
702644f-b.text:
112 East 21st Street, adjointng the S. W. corner of Caton
Avenue, showing the Clarkson Mansion, built in 1836. It was later
known as the Midwood Club and was for a time used by the Brooklyn
Union League after they gave up their Grant Square quarters. In
the late 1930s it was known as the Sperry Memorial Butlding and
was then the Flatbush branch of the Y. M. C. A. For additional
data see ''The New York Times,'' Octoer 6, 1940.
1923
Views 1,2
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection
